Author: Annie Sobol
Review: This pin brings you to the end of the path. Lots of small bridges along the route for photo taking opportunities along with many cute stores and restaurants to explore. Parking is also abundant along the path as well.

Author: Nick Fujita
Review: Amazing pathway to walk during Sakura season! Probably one of the most beautiful I‚Äôve ever seen

Author: Rahul Kurup
Review: Beautiful hidden place. Amazing to see all sakura petals forming a flower river üòç

Author: Jane Song
Review: Definitely beautiful for cherry blossoms but way too many people during the season. Highly recommend during non covid time.

Author: Emoney Flex
Review: It‚Äôs dope during cherry blossom season, otherwise it‚Äôs just a nice little walk.

Author: Kayla Marie
Review: One of the most beautiful paths I‚Äôve ever walked on. Wake up early to enjoy the walk. I happened to visit during peak bloom of cherry blossom season and it was a magical experience. My favorite part of visiting Kyoto.

Author: Mary
Review: Absolutely beautiful no matter the season. This area can be pretty crowded but it is still very much worth the visit. There are several sights to see along the way, as well as plenty of places to eat or have a snack.

Author: Norris C
Review: Peaceful walk along this path, which connects multiple temples in the area.

Author: Vinodh Joseph
Review: One of the beautiful place to enjoy sakura and walkthrough... Highly recommended

Author: Elias Chelala
Review: Philosopher's Walk is a nice pathway that follows a canal lined by Cherry Blossom trees in Kyoto. I recommend taking a stroll if you are in the city as this adventure will cost you absolutely nothing but lifetime memories. There are lots of nearby temples in the area if you are interested in site seeing along your cerebral travels.

Author: Dima Balandin
Review: Some people visiting only the main touristic spots (crowded and busy) and the central streets of the city (consisted of modern buildings and shops) feel a little bit disappointed because they couldn‚Äôt feel that serene and quiet atmosphere of Kyoto which is described in so many essays and books. But here, walking along this small canal in a quiet residential area you can get that beautiful feeling of calmness and peacefulness of the old Kyoto

Author: –Æ–ª–∏—è –í–æ–ª–∫–æ–≤–∞
Review: Very nice shooting area in all seasons!

Author: Hans Bobanovits
Review: Beautiful spot! I highly recommend during the week as the week-end is way too crowded!

Author: Yiwen Gong
Review: Sakura river close to Ginkakuji entrance is the best.

Author: Hari Krishna
Review: Beautiful path. We didn't walk the entire path. There are lots of Sakura trees

Author: TED
Review: I wish I could walk along this path every day!  (Apr. 2022)

Author: Kiara
Review:
The Philosopher's Path (Tetsugaku no michi) is a pleasant stone path through the northern part of Kyoto's Higashiyama district.

The path follows a canal which is lined by hundreds of cherry trees. üå∏ü•∞ Free. (06.04.2022)

Author: Dorothy Condon
Review: Beautiful during cherry blossom season!!

Author: KSRG 14
Review: It's the Philosopher's Path.  I went there in the off season.  It is a small path with a calm atmosphere along the creek.  I walked between Ginkaku-ji Temple and Nanzen-ji Temple.

Author: B. A.
Review: Very beautiful path surrounded by nature.  Lovely spot for peaceful walk by the river, under the huge trees. Also you may find so many attractions by the neighbourhood temples, local souvenier shops, caf√®'s, restaurants.

Author: shane lee
Review: Less than what I expected although it is famous!

Author: Coby Goldberg
Review: has a well deserved place among the top one hundred roads of japan

Author: Hans Chan
Review: Nothing special here to be honest

Author: Judy OBrien
Review: This is a lovely riverside walk, nice at any time of year. For the best views however,  come in spring for the cherry blossoms and in autumn for the autumn leaves. After visiting Ginkakuji it's great to walk down and visit some of the other temples on the path.

Author: sabina pip
Review: Worth a walk in the sunset. Very romantic.

Author: Stephanie Roy
Review: Very nice path with a lots of tree and a small river. It is lovely!

Author: A Roj
Review: Scenic walk, very quiet and lots of interesting houses on the way, also galleries, and many cats hanging about

Author: Matty Hammo
Review: A peaceful walk along the canal, with beautiful foliage and some smaller shrines along the way.

Author: Christopher Frey
Review: The Philosopher‚Äôs Path offers a nice walk along a canal. However, I assume much of the allure is the cherry blossom season. Otherwise if feels a little pedestrian positioned alongside residential housing in my opinion. Not sure its worth the trek in the offseason

Author: RY
Review: the combination with brook and leaves' color on each season are cool for photos.

Author: Dean Shams
Review: I went in Jan 2023. Even in winter conditions it was a calming and beautiful path to walk. I won‚Äôt say it‚Äôs a must visit. But if you have extra time after visiting other attractions has closed then put this in as a side trip.

Author: Riz Moon
Review: Maybe an excellent place to visit in spring. In winter it's still good but not much better than other places in Kyoto in My point of view

Author: ËóçÂÅâ‰ªª
Review: The Way of Philosophy is famous for its cherry blossoms, and it has a special scenery in winter. Walking on the road and thinking about life choices.

Author: carl hong
Review: It is a place where four seasons are beautiful.The road is quite uncomfortable to walk on.

Author: Conni Watson
Review: Was a lovely walk, even at the time we visited with the trees being bare. A good start to the day, encouraging peace of mind before entering the silver temple.

Author: HuiHoon Tan
Review: Enjoy the slow walk and many shops to explore

Author: B W
Review: A peaceful and beautiful walk to view Sakura. We came a bit early to catch the early bloom view. It will be more beautiful when all Sakura are fully bloom.

Author: S Kami
Review: Beautiful cheery blossom in full bloom.

Author: Faina Shatskina
Review: Buitifulle walk surrounded by blooming trees. Temples can visit

Author: Em U

Author: Mark H
Review: Very pretty spot to experience cherry blossoms. Worth the time to visit and experience.

Author: Habiba Nabila Ihlasuddini
Review: This street was crowd as we came at 12.30pm that made it hard to capture good photos. But It sure felt good to be able to walk peacefully under lots of sakura trees. This is a beautiful place to enjoy Sakura

Author: Lukas Bauer
Review: Nice to walk along in spring, even though there are many tourists taking photos

Author: „Ç∏„Ç®„Éº„É†„Çπ
Review: Especially nice area during sakura season, but always a great walk any time of year. Sakura in full bloom March 30, 2023. They were on April 1, 2022. If you want to be there with very few other people, I recommend getting there just after sunrise, which is when I took these pictures.

Author: Neslie
Review:
Visited on March 29,2023

Cherry Blossoms were in Full Bloom
Many group tours were happening even before noon.

Nevertheless, Love this place

Author: Jaak Peldes
Review: Great place to stroll around. We walked from down to up ‚Äî from Keage subway station.

Author: Brent Mauriello
Review: My favorite place in the world to walk slowly.

Author: Nitika
Review:
Beautiful spot to cherish the views of cherry blossoms along a flowing water body. The walking path is very narrow so it can get a little tricky with a lot of crowds but still manageable if you walk on the road.

There are a few stalls selling local foods along the path but very few benches to sit and relax.

Author: David Hart
Review: It‚Äôs simply beautiful.

Author: Albert Jonathan
Review: A beautiful path next to a river full of cherry blossom trees.

Author: Sylvia Diamant
Review: We went early in the morning (around 8 am) on March 28 and we were awarded with peaceful walk along the narrow stream. Start your walk from southern end walking towards the Ginkakuji Temple so the morning sun will be behind you. You will get better pictures that way. It was a beautiful walkway with wonderful Sakura. However we found that Sewaritei park is even better with amazing cherry trees all lined up.

Author: Terence Lee
Review: Nice place to walk around during the cherry blossom mornings

Author: HedgeHodge ‚ÄúHodgePodge‚Äù
Review: Hands down the best spot to see Sakura blooms in the spring in Kyoto that I have found so far. It looks like a scene straight out of an anime. The trees are in full bloom and when the wind blows, the petals are scattered everywhere. There are lots of shops and both lining the Biwako Canal so you can grab a snack while you walk and take pictures.

Author: Andrew Ma
Review: A lovely walk to view Sakura.

Author: Bernadette Estepa (Gaijin Guide)
Review: Would have been a perfectly lovely long walk had it been devoid of the presence of other people, hahahahaha! Unfortunately that is not the case but that is also not the fault of the place so I still give this place 5 stars out of five. If you deviate you will find yourself in other points of interest.

Author: Charlotte Chan
Review:
10/10 for sakura
3/30/2023
It was extremely crowded. However, it was very worth it. Sakura was at its peak! The sakura was along river and it was very pretty. There are many photo spot along the way. We also saw 4-5 stray but very well-taken care of cats. One of them is friendly enough for you to give it some pats and chin scratches.

Author: Samantha Carbonell
Review:
A must do in kyoto! Especially if your visiting during the cherry blossom season, or the firefly season.
Wish I could witness the fireflies!

Author: mIzTeR dEe
Review: Beautiful Place for Sakura Viewing..such a wonderful experience will visit again next year

Author: Bruce Vang
Review: We got there near the end of the Sakura bloom timeframe is what I assumed. Less pretty than most pictures. Just think of it as a walkway and it's not so special. A nearby park where the river splits is much prettier and where all the local goes. Less touristy and more serene.

Author: Karanvir Singh
Review: Beautiful area to walk amongst the cherry blossom.

Author: H N
Review: Visited in early April. Narrow stroll along a creek was very peaceful with many blooming flowers. Not too many commercial vendors.

Author: Kristyna Tynkova
Review: Beautiful very peaceful path that connects multiple temples and shrines.

Author: joosiong wong
Review: Is a beautiful place for cherry blossoms viewing

Author: Kajtek Jankowski
Review: Good place for just walking and enjoying the weather, there were some cute shops and cafes on the sides, would reccomend going there before 5pm since that's when most places are getting closed

Author: Mark Tong
Review: everything is pink, and every place is photo killer. clean, and full of romance. a must go place for wedding photography. this place have no railway station, you can ride the bus (but not recommend)or taxi.  the bus is too crowded.

Author: michael see
Review: Visited this place in the night. It was very quite and peaceful. The place was not brightly lighted and couldn‚Äôt experienced the full extend of its beauty. It makes a quiet walk after dinner which was nice.

Author: Nikunj Patel
Review: Nice

Author: Jordon Chua
Review: Nice chill spot to stroll through. Plenty of cherry blossom trees planted along the paths

Author: International Tempo
Review: Another sakura appreciation location during cherry blossom. Crowded tourists are expectable.

Author: Neha Kaushik
Review: Loved it and could see why Kitaro Nishida walked and meditated/reflected while walking this path.. wonderful experience.

Author: Ken Teh
Review: Great path to walk through when on the way to Ginkaku-ji.. makes the journey interesting..

Author: Ang Chu Sean
Review: Beautiful Sakura spot in kyoto, I can stay here for whole evening

Author: Ankur Goyal
Review: Simply beautiful place and Cherry blossom üå∏ just make it more enjoyable

Author: Jeremy Farquhar
Review: Was a beautiful, tranquil walk out of the tourist season and was even more beautiful during cherry blossom season. Of course there are many more tourists to deal with and it‚Äôs not so tranquil. But stunning photos and still not over-crowded. Great little shops and cafes along the way.

Author: Alessandro
Review: Beautiful path with lots of cherry trees.

Author: Crafted By Zee
Review: Beautiful during Sakura season

Author: Joe Gunn
Review: A very pleasant walk with plenty of blossom. Despite being there mid-morning on a Saturday it wasn't busy. Highly recommend if you're in the area.

Author: YY
Review:
Sakura is gone by the time we are there on 13-Apr in 2023.. Still could see some remnants and some lone rangers remaining though.

Could imagine how pretty this stretch would be when it‚Äôs in full bloom üå∏ hopefully can get to see it in future.

Author: Xin Wang
Review: Very scenic route! Only about 1km but very beautiful photographic spots along the path, especially spring time during full bloom.

Author: Nikolai Iosifov
Review: Must visit during Sakura Blossom.

Author: Henry Edwards
Review: Loved it

Author: Erwin Abel
Review: Beautiful walk along the Canal. Very pretty and free of charge.

Author: Wendy Nguyen
Review: We got here around 7:00 PM, after diner at Gion area. It was dark, but the color of sakura blooming light up the whole path. It is so beautiful even at night, I can‚Äôt imagine how beautiful it is during the day.

Author: Fran
Review: Beautiful path, first time we went it was full with sakuras blooming but this time we arrive late sakuras we‚Äôre gone, there were other flowers blooming thought.  There are several temples around that you can visit.

Author: pablo pablo pablo
Review: Very pretty and harmonious, surprisingly low amounts of simps taking pics for their partners

Author: Sophie Proust
Review:
Absolutely go during sakura season!!!
The stroll through the snow of cherry blossom petals was one of the most magical moments of my trip!
Very funny festival vibes as well with all the food to go and ice cream shops.
Like anywhere touristy in Kyoto it is fairly crowded though‚Ä¶

Author: Andreas Gebhardt
Review: Beautiful but if the weather is good it's overrun by tourists üòÖ. Try for the early morning and during the week.

Author: Sanka Illangakoon
Review: The Philosopher's Path in Kyoto is a serene and picturesque walkway lined with cherry blossoms and temples. It follows a canal that's said to have been a favorite route of the philosopher Nishida Kitaro. The path is perfect for a peaceful stroll and offers a glimpse into Kyoto's rich cultural heritage. We used this path to walk towards Higashiyama Jisho-ji and found it very peaceful. It was disappointing that the cherry blossom season has passed by the time we visited which would have been a great addition to our visit. Highly recommended!

Author: Peggy G
Review: Lovely stroll next to the little river, very peaceful and lots of beautiful temples along the path

Author: Max Pietsch (Max)
Review: We had a wonderful walk down this beautiful path, stopping by some quiet beautiful temples along the way. We came around 9am or so and it wasn't busy. It's nice that so many temples are along this route, some of them more hidden, which is nice, and the path itself is nice too.

Author: Chloe
Review: Great place to clear your head from the crowd of the city and to have some time in ‚Äúnature‚Äù (very calm and green path)‚Ä¶ Very peaceful place to wonder along the canal. A few shops (cafes, icecream shop, pottery shops ‚Ä¶) are along the path.

Author: Gunnar Caya
Review: This path travels along a small stream from nearby Nanzen-ji Temple all the way to Higashiyama Jisho-ji / Ginkaku-ji Temple. Although you will see a fair amount of people along the path, it is far more peaceful and serene than the rest of downtown Kyoto, and the views along the way are nice too. Definitely the best way of travelling between these two temples, and worth visiting in its own right

Author: Julian Lau
Review: Peaceful serenity.

Author: Shreyamsa Manjunath
Review: Famous for the visuals it offers during cherry blossom season, but equally attractive at other times too! The path runs next to a quaint little canal from Lake Biwa, connecting Ginkaku-ji to Nanzen-ji temples. Once a path traversed by a certain philosopher, it now houses many cafes & restaurants on either side. In spite of the commercial aspects, opportunities for philosophising are aplenty! May become busy at times, but it's not unusual to have a whole stretch to oneself. A multitude of flowering plants, with ducks and carps in the canal, and cultured cats outside are an added attraction. Why not, check it out!

Author: Manohar R
Review: It says open 24hrs. Yes. But there are no lights around. So not recommended for evening or night visits. Pitch drak!

Author: tal franji
Review: Very nice area to walk. Transportation not that convenient and I would not visit when it's busy because itt's a narrow path

Author: Aaron Benanav
Review: Well worth a visit. We started on the southern end and walked north. The philosopher's path is a relaxing, beautiful place to walk. There are fish in the creek. Definitely get lunch at Juugo (but make a reservation) for amazing soba noodles. There are nice coffee shops all along the way. The temple at the north end of the path has a very beautiful garden walk as well.

Author: Joy Bose
Review: A wonderful meditative and relaxing path surrounded by temples.

Author: Food Boss
Review: Not worth going. It is basically a stroll along the open drain behind people's houses. Might be nicer during the Sakura season but then I am sure there are better places to stroll along during the Cherry Blossom time. Also hard to get to as there is no direct transportation to the place.

Author: Dirk Hebecker
Review: nice place, busy, touristy
